body: Can you try the latest beta and see if you can reproduce the issue with it? If so, please paste the log from that.
@darthShadow Thank you for your quick support. I'll test it out and get back to you.

I am now testing with the following version:

```
rclone v1.55.0-beta.5334.d6870473a
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.16.2
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: cmount
```

A message that I did not notice before or did not appear where I am at a loss right now. There are just increased problems that occur with individual folders:

```
2021/03/24 10:53:53 NOTICE: Encrypted drive 'dropbox:': ChangeNotify was unable to decrypt "1l77gk0gcijgrei4hlvr7ugoc/569vnmue4q5nvl9s5rhu8h2bt8/u8kc3jgspqf9sgh1ndi38nopmf9n5cdnpmbugv8k9sr8b5squlnt85l00sah3gp239oear3khr8je": illegal base32 data at input byte 25
2021/03/24 10:53:53 NOTICE: Encrypted drive 'dropbox:': ChangeNotify was unable to decrypt "1l77gk0gcijgrei4hlvr7ugoc/569vnmue4q5nvl9s5rhu8h2bt8/u8kc3jgspqf9sgh1ndi38nopmf9n5cdnpmbugv8k9sr8b5squlnt85l00sah3gp239oear3khr8je/f68s6an5n2fmffai81oqumadhfcmb8qj7omahnae53u3l9sm8uut9u2pg8q525q3p1o0n34g25pgu": illegal base32 data at input byte 25
```

Otherwise, it runs just felt more stable... but I continue to observe it...
Can you please add your redacted config?
@wolveix Can you take a look at this? I am guessing the `entryPath` manipulation we are doing in the `changeNotifyRunner` function in the dropbox remote is breaking the crypt decryption logic.

rename.from: rclone mount with Dropbox (too many requests error, mount freeze)
rename.to: dropbox: Unable to decrypt returned paths from changeNotify

body:
> Can you please add your redacted config?

```
[dropbox_unencrypted]
type = dropbox
token = {"access_token":"XXX","token_type":"bearer","refresh_token":"XXX","expiry":"2021-03-24T14:47:11.666625156+01:00"}

[dropbox]
type = crypt
remote = dropbox_unencrypted:Folder/Folder
filename_encryption = standard
directory_name_encryption = true
password = XXX (62 length)
password2 = XXX (62 length)
```
Do I understand this correctly: Everything is fine with my data, but polling is supported in the beta and here decryption does not work for data checked via polling?

> Yes, you are correct.

Okay, then I am reassured :) And look forward to @wolveix his fix.

> I'll look into this shortly.

@wolveix Have you had time to look at it? :)

> > I'll look into this shortly.
> 
> @wolveix Have you had time to look at it? :)

Sorry for the wait, been a busy week. I'll make sure to review this tomorrow :)
By the way, the original problem is not fixed with the latest beta. :( I first thought that this is now fixed but I guess I was wrong.
Working on a fix now. I believe I've resolved the decryption issue, but I'm unsure about the original issue described in this request.

I was able to narrow it down to something to do with API errors like "too_many_requests" and the associated rate limit. It seems that not only new requests are postponed but also entries that actually come from the cache are not answered anymore.
